result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew R Ritchie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mathew R Ritchie not in court.Called 3:22 PM. FTR recorded. Court orders $100/month, commencing 6/1/16.
Payment hearing on May 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mathew R Ritchie in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:20 PM. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requriements - no response or VIS - defendant would plead to count #1 as alleged with $500 fine plus costs and surcharges, #2 - DRI, #3 - amend to county ordinance of DC with $500.00 forfeiture plus costs. Cirilli and Ritchie agree. Ritchie pleads NC to count #1. Court amends count #3 to county ordinance of DC, plead NC, finds G, find of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - 60 DTP/CO, Court dismisses and reads in count #3. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Cirilli - follow joint recommendation. Ritchie withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - $500 fine plus costs totalling $1120.00 - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA sample with expungement rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim (PN)

Defendant Mathew R Ritchie in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Mathew R Ritchie in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:41 PM. State - believes the PH is being waived - not pursuing felony conviction. Cirilli and Ritchie agree and Cirilli provides the Court with a waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the Court has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint. Cirilli has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm. Cirilli now wants to address bond, asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State has no objection. Court - bond - $2500 signature bond with same conditions.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mathew R Ritchie, in custody, appears via video from FC jail with attorney Gary S. Cirilli appearing in court. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:49 AM. Cirilli has complaint and waives reading of it but does not believe that the defendant has a copy of it. Ricthie does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Cirilli and Ritchie understand charges and penalties. Cirilli waives further reading, requests PH, wishes to address bond. Cirilli - bonds - request signature bond for stated reasons with conditions to continue. Ritchie states he is on a 60 day ATR and that should expire on 2/23/16. Cirilli withdraws request for signature bond and waives time limits. Court continues bond, sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim (PN)
